tripleplay.util
Class Timer

java.lang.Object
  tripleplay.util.Timer

public class Timer
extends Object

Handles execution of actions after a specified delay.

Nested Class Summary
static interface Timer.Handle
          A handle on registered actions that can be used to cancel them.
 
Constructor Summary
Timer()
          Creates a timer instance that can be used to schedule actions.
 
Method Summary
 Timer.Handle after(int millis, Runnable action)
          Executes the supplied action after the specified number of milliseconds have elapsed.
 Timer.Handle atThenEvery(int initialMillis, int repeatMillis, Runnable action)
          Executes the supplied action starting initialMillis from now and every repeatMillis there after.
 Timer.Handle every(int millis, Runnable action)
          Executes the supplied action starting millis from now and every millis thereafter.
 void update()
          This should be called from Game#update, or similar.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Timer

public Timer()
Creates a timer instance that can be used to schedule actions. Don't forget to call update() on it, every frame.

Method Detail

after

public Timer.Handle after(int millis,
                          Runnable action)
Executes the supplied action after the specified number of milliseconds have elapsed.

Returns:
a handle that can be used to cancel the execution of the action.

every

public Timer.Handle every(int millis,
                          Runnable action)
Executes the supplied action starting millis from now and every millis thereafter.

Returns:
a handle that can be used to cancel the execution of the action.

atThenEvery

public Timer.Handle atThenEvery(int initialMillis,
                                int repeatMillis,
                                Runnable action)
Executes the supplied action starting initialMillis from now and every repeatMillis there after.

Returns:
a handle that can be used to cancel the execution of the action.

update

public void update()
This should be called from Game#update, or similar.
